info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 01 at 6:29PM EDT until June 01 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PORTAGE...SOUTHERN TRUMBULL AND MAHONING COUNTIES... At 628 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Leavittsburg to Lordstown to 9 miles north of Sebring, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Youngstown, Warren, Boardman, Niles, Campbell, Hubbard, Canfield, Newton Falls, Lordstown, Hilltop, Maplewood Park, Leavittsburg, Vienna Center, Austintown, Struthers, Girard, McDonald, Poland, Ellsworth and Windham. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
